name: marianne mcleod
text:
This organization is a state wide nonprofit. They are the only Service Dog Organization in the state of Alabama approved by the Alabama Department of education to be in public schools throughout the state.

They provide excellent training for PTSD, Diabetic alert, Autism and mobility issues.  The staff is top notch!

name: David Blackburn
text:
Great organization!

Currently our family has "Nikki" which has been great for us! Initially she was placed with our, then 11 y/o son, for autism intervention. Ashley remained in contact with us for updates on his and Nikki's bonding process. Unfortunately, the lack of a bond meant Nikki was not the correct match. The organization took Nikki back to give additional training based on our conversations, and recommendations.

Next, Nikki returned to our family because she had built a decent bond with our daughter during her initial placement. Nikki is doing very well with our 14 y/o daughter, and has helped her in many ways. Her training has been helpful with nightmares, anxiety in the transition to high school, and interaction in general.

Throughout the process, Service Dogs of Alabama responded to our concerns, provided training suggestions, conducted follow-up training, and is working to find a match for our son.

After a few years of searching, Service Dogs of Alabama was not only the best costing organization, but provided a well trained service dog, assistance when we had issues with public places that hassled us about the service dog being in the facilities.

I cannot thank Ashley and Francis enough for what they have done for our family!

Sincerely,

David B.

name: CHEYANNA DENNIS
text: Hi guys I don't know you so I wanted to tell you people that I am In Missippi and I am missing a shih-tzu In Alabama and the color of him is Blond and A little Brown and he does not have a color and the very last thing is his name is Olaf If you find him come down to me on county road Thank You.

name: Arthur Stanton
text: Absolutely wonderful,wish I could work there.The staff is the best I have seen anywhere.

name: Chuck Fusina
text: Ashley and Francis are true professionals that dramatically changed the quality of life for my son, they will do everything they can to help you. We thought we would never be able to raise the money, but with some effort, and prayers we made it happen! The service dog has been a true blessing, and he is so well trained that all we receive is compliments when the dog is out in public. I would HIGHLY recommend Service Dogs Alabama to everyone! They are doing such amazing work and are two of the nicest, most dedicated people you will ever meet!

name: Kelly Henson
text:
My son has type 1 diabetes. He was diagnosed 6 years ago. A true blessing came to us a little over a year ago. That was Service Dogs of Alabama. The entire process has been and remains to be amazing. This organization changes lives. They start with an amazing and very thorough training process and continue with placement of these services dogs in their forever homes. They continue the relationship with the families after the placement is made. They are always available to answer any questions and continue helping in any way they can.

My son's dog, Pierce, has brought a peace of mind to our family that we never thought we would have again.

Pierce means everything to us. He is my son's life line. He alerts when his blood sugars are out of range so that he can correct the issue and avoid potential problems.
The founders, Frances and Ashley, are completely committed to helping people find have a better quality of life when life has dealt them struggles.
Pierce is our family. Service Dogs of Alabama became our family too!!!

name: K Morgan
text: My daughter has had her service dog for almost a year now. We cannot imagine our lives without her in it! She is the most intelligent, well trained dog. This is an amazing group of people who truly have a passion for what they do. Still to this day, if I have a question the response is always fast. Ashley made sure my daughter was comfortable and confident in working with her dog. You will not be disappointed with SDA! They have been a blessing to my family!!

name: Tank Holland
text: website was easy to navigate look like good training going on there but everytime I hit service dog training it said that the training was not available I gave it to stars for the website and we'll keep checking back to find out when they have service dog training going on

name: Bill Watters
text: I can attest Service Dogs of Alabama has changed the lives of many for the better. My son Matt was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes at age 4. After reading an internet article on Diabetic Alert Dogs (DAD’s) my wife and I was motivated to find more about how a DAD could improve the quality of life for Matt and our family. We found many stories of success and quite a few horror stories as well. In our search, we ran across the name of a dog trainer in our area, Frances. I called Frances and told her our story. I told her of our fear of Matt going to sleep and not recognizing a low then going into a seizure. I told her of how we feared Matt coming up on driving age and getting in the car after practicing sports and not realizing a low blood sugar and having a seizure while driving. We had these fears because Matt had seizures due to failure to recognize the signs and symptoms of low blood sugars. I was hoping Frances could point me in some direction but she did much more than that. After hearing our story, she told me she worked with a service dog organization but their organization had never trained a DAD but if we were willing to work with her she would do her best to help. We did and so did she. Frances and Ashley worked to develop was has become a very successful Diabetic Alert Dog Training program at Service Dogs of Alabama. We are very thankful for all this organization has done for all they work with.

name: Erica Lewis
text: We found this organization because my sister needed a seizure alert dog. Service Dogs of Alabama not only works with volunteers to lower the cost of a service dog, but it also works with the individual families and recipients to help them understand how their life will change with a service animal. Speaking about service dogs alone, I am so grateful that my sister has the autonomy, confidence, and overall sense of safety that comes along with her dog. Beyond that, the organization itself is truly a gift to all who come into contact with it. For my sister, the trainers have been nothing but supportive and only a call or text away when she has a question or concern. For myself, I am currently socializing a service dog as a volunteer, and it has helped me to understand what it is like to have a service dog in addition to giving me the opportunity to help educate others about them. I would suggest volunteering here to anyone looking for a place to donate time or resources, because it is such a great cause. Service animals save lives every day, and Service Dog of Alabama makes this a possibility for families and individuals who would not usually be able to afford it.

name: Walt Frazier
text: The best gym I've been to in a long time. I judge a gym by 3 things: Atmosphere, location and equipment. This place gets top star for all 3. Located in a very busy intersection making it easy to  access. There's no excuse not to go. It's a throw back atmosphere with modern equipment. You can tell the owners wanted it to be a relaxing family environment because of how welcoming the staff makes you feel. The fact it's one of the largest helps and the owners work out daily helps them stay in touch with the needs of the members. What I liked most is the variety. Rarely do you find a gym that's big enough to offer more than fitness. At this place, they offer martial arts, crossfit section, bodybuilding, aerobics, meals, smoothie bar and several other classes to meet your fitness needs. If in search of a gym home, go try it out and tell them Walt sent ya.

text: The faculty, staff, & students are so friendly. It's a very welcoming, hospitable place. The majority of the young women are very talented, creative, eager to excel, & just delightful to be around. Among them are beautiful, sweet faces whose goodness radiates from sweet souls.  .  .  .a little bit of heaven on Earth.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your sweet words, Claudia. We strive daily to be a "home" for our students, because we feel that when their basic needs are met (especially feeling "at home"), they feel prepared/eager to show that same care and concern to others--thereby reflecting Light and Truth in the world. :)

text: I've gone here for two years now. It has become my home away from home, and I hate having to be away for summers! The people are great, the buildings are being fixed up, and the food improves daily! Yes, it has it's flaws, and it isn't right for everyone, but Judson is the place where young women can go in and become life longer learners. We also don't usually meet our husbands here, but we do get to meet our bridesmaids :) Hope this helped out someone!

text:
Everything has changed in the Loaves & Fishes stores they look nice but the prices have went up. From what i gather, management has changed.
I used to would shop at several of the locations at least once a week. I would pick up things for others who were in need as well. If it didnt work for them at thrift prices i could afford to buy it & put it back til i found someone who could wear/use it.
Now I can't afford to do that. The last time I went shopping there, I came back with 3 used clothing items which cost me around $15. My mom came over with new clothes she had gotten on sell fot $1 at Walmart. The point of thrifting is being thrifty. JCPenny's & other department stores has new clothes for clearance around these prices.
I enjoy the "treasure seeking" process of going to the thrift store but it is more fun when the treasure wasn't wrestling for a spot in your budget.
I'm not the only one who feels this way. The parking lots used to stay full of customers. Now nit nearly as much traffic goes through there to weed through the donated goods. Thankfully there are more & more options popping up around our area.
I will still go by there sometimes but not my go to spots anymore.

text: Mustard Seed African School Ministries is a legitimate Christian non-profit that focuses on ministering to the children of Malawi and Zambia using local ministers in those countries. I have been a dedicated supporter of this ministry and have known  the president (Russ Medley) for 30 years. They use donations wisely to maximize the number of children reached in Africa.

name: Hannah Schiller
text: Awesome, kind, dedicated people work here. They do so much to help so many amazing, determined, and beautiful people with disabilities of all kinds, physical and mental. If you (or any loved ones) have any kind of disability and are looking to find work or better your life in any way, this is your place. They offer jobs, job training, education (such as literacy tutoring, GED preparation), and childcare! Their program Kaleidoscope seems to enriching the lives of so many adults with disabilities that otherwise, in some cases, consign them to a fairly limited lifestyle. There they can find fellowship, community, support, and maybe most importantly, fun! The testimony given on our tour was given by a mom whose adult child takes part, and she said it totally transformed her daughter who has since become dramatically more independent and less depressed.  I am so impressed with this organization and the difference it seems to be making in so many peoples' lives. If you are interested in volunteering (I am going to start!) or working with them (on your own or in connection to your business)--or if you're just curious about the organization, I highly recommend taking the free tour of their facilities. I don't know if this always happens or not, but I was really impressed that the CEO himself spoke at our tour and was totally accessible and open to any questions.

text: I think management or just manager was changed. My son had ymca learning program at this time for online class due to c19. Last week was horrible. I sent zoom meeting information with teacher email on Tue which is saying that she would need class in zoom meeting at first week. Manager replied she needs schoology log in info. I had to reply again on Wed morning that my son needed to attend zoom meeting instead of schoology. But he missed Wed. I sent email again that let him attend on Thur & Fri finally. On Thur, my son missed again. So during meeting, I called manager to check it out. She did not know it. Finally on Fri. my son attended fully. So my son was not happy and comfortable with YMCA service. Me neither. Without care, I paid $120 each week. My son told me his elder sister could help him instead of YMCA. So this week Mon, as soon as my son dropped in YMCA, I sent email to manager that I need to cancel. She replied she saw my son and asked me about changing my mind. I replied immediately that I would want to cancel asap your confirmation. She replied at 11oclock that she cancelled from next week. So I called her and asked her that I wanted to cancel this week and get refund. She said that even one day attendance would change all week payment. So she won't give refund no matter one day attendance of my son. It does not make sense at all. YMCA is very greedy. Even I sent her email at 8clock at Monday morning. I sent email to manager and cc to director. But the same reply. Very greedy. I am still very mad at this.

Ms Lauren is excellent! She was super efficient with everything. She helped me to understand everything we discussed.
Go See Her If You Need Help!

name: Ken Shows
text: Very helpful and nice people

name: Doreen Vaughn
text: Awesome. VERY helpful with reviewing the health insurance availability with our individual needs of my sister, mother and myself. Thank You ❤️

name: Justin Rickman
text: Great people who offer great services to those who need it.

name: Julia D
text: I made an appointment here to help me select the best Medicare plan for my father.  They were helpful and went through all options.  I'd recommend the organization to anyone coming of senior age or a person who has an aging parent and just dont know where to get information.

name: James David
text: Dana was one of the Most Knowledgeable person I have ever have spoken with. Listening to Dana help  my Mother approved for Medicaid, she is a True Caring Professional that is always ready to Help!

name: Edith Posey
text:
Had questions about Medicare Advantage Plan
All was answered to my satisfaction

name: Beverly Armstrong
text: The meals are always late. Some weeks not showing up at all. Otherwise a good agency.

name: Sheila Borders
text: Wasted  my. Time I am in great need of help payingy power billy daughter was in a domestic violence marriage whge her husband left he cleared out both of her accounts and we are having trouble catching up because we get paid once a month they are going to cut our. Power off the 26th of October

name: Linda Mc
text: Extremely helpful!!

name: Tide Fan
text: Professional very helpful

name: william slawson
text: Very professional and great help

name: Nancy Jones
text: They take care of their people

name: Vicki Seals
text: A very caring ministry.

name: Stacie Willis
text: I went there and it really was like no one cared about me but only getting their money I had been through so much before I got there I was abused by my boyfriend and abandoned by my own family not to mention I was on drugs ,I had a roommate that was stealing from the center and they punished me not her I had the worst client rep she only cared about the ones who had money.. I left the center and got clean all on my own without their help I mean I tried to ask for help no one wanted to hear my story Brenda just ignored my cry for real help I never relapsed the whole time I was there.. I’d never refer someone to that money making place they don’t care about you only the money....

name: Mandy Armitage
text: I have never met 2 women that have hearts as big and genuine as Mrs. Brenda and Mrs. Malinda... The Lovelady Center changed my life and gave me all the tools to utilize out in the world to remain sober and drug free. My relationship with my kids has been restored and I now have a handsome grandson that I am able to spend lots of time with. Had I not went to The Lovelady Center there is no telling if I would even still be alive. Thank you so much for all that you have done for me Mrs. Brenda and Mrs. Malinda. I am now a much stronger, happier, independent woman and I was able to become this woman with the help that The Lovelady Center gave me. This a picture of my most handsome and wonderful grandson. Thank you Lord for The Lovelady Center!!

name: Angela Edwards
text: Man, this place is so amazing!! Everyone is just so nice here, and they love u so much... This place has taught me how to live life without drugs. I learned how to love myself ❤️ I wouldn't wanna be anywhere else. We're one big family, here at the lovelady center it doesn't matter where you come from, They take you in and treat you like family, they even let you have your sweet babies here . We have a church and a kid zone . Transportation and walmart trips 👌🏼 , Im currently in phase 4 of 5 . I'll be forever thankful for the lovelady and staff . N the best part is they are christian based ✝️🙌🏼

name: Gabriel Bruzzi
text: My daughter has some mental issues and addictive drug issues as well. She had been there years ago for what she was going thru back then. They took her back again with open arms as she is going thru allot now. They called me to let me know she got there ok from Amtrak as they picked her up. I pray and hope she gets the help that they can provide for her. Having the word of God is such great help as well.

name: Michael Ganey
text: From Hevan was sent the lady's running the love lady center. They have saved and changed my wife's life. And with the power of God backing the ladies, nothing can stop them. God Bless you all. Thank You !!!!!

name: Jessica Kuerner
text: We scheduled a donation pickup and they called the day before to confirm, but then never showed up!  For several days we had to haul it out to the driveway and then haul it back in so it wouldn't get rained on, and they were so rude on the phone when we tried to confirm they were ever going to come get it!  Why bother calling us the day before and then not show up?  Luckily there are many other organizations in Birmingham that are responsive and grateful for donations, like The Exchange Club!

name: David Melton
text: What a load this place is. I cant recommend using Lovelady to make donations. They’ll call and tell you a truck will be in your area accepting donations for pickup but then they never show up. Then they’ll call you to reschedule, but they still won’t show up. I had several boxes of my mother’s clothes waiting outside for six days for them to pick up. When they finally did show, they picked up a couple small items and left everything else with a note saying they I needed to call again to reschedule. Only problem is, the next few days rain was expected so I had to haul everything back into the house. I’ve called several times since then and they won’t answer, ignore my calls, or send me to voicemail. So exhausting dealing with them. It’s almost like they get off on stringing me along but I’m not gonna beg them to come pick up my stuff. They should be the ones asking me. Oh wait, that’s right they did ask me when they called in the first place. Yeah, right. Good luck with that. I wanted to donate my mother’s clothing. She passed a way a few month’s ago and would have wanted it that way. But I can’t deal with the ineptitude, incompetence, and unreliability of Lovelady.

name: Steph Casey
text: Tonia Silas do you not understand what it means to work for your room and board?  Tell me where on Earth (other than jail) that you can go live for free? It is a shame that you are not the first person to come to the Lovelady with that attitude and you probably won't be the last. I've got news for you though; until you get real about living a productive life, supporting yourself and not blaming everyone else for all of your problems your life is not gonna change. There are many people in this world that do not care about you, your circumstances or your salvation, but Miss Brenda and Miss Melinda actually do.

name: Stephanie Casey
text: I love the Lovelady! I am grateful that this place exists to help people like myself. I am disappointed to hear people badmouth this place when there are such good people doing their best to cater to our every need. We need a place to stay? We got it. A soft, warm bed? We got it. Food to eat? We've got it. Clothing? We got it. Someone to talk to? (in the form of amazing counselors and client reps)-we've got it. Transportation? We've got it. Healthcare services? We've got it. Family legal assistance? We've got it. Stop complaining! I'm a firm believer that we are a family-a family of survivors...and a family in Christ. Stop talking bad about my family!

name: Dennis Turnbaugh
text: First of all I need to apologize to Ms. Brenda and Ms. Melinda for the review I posted 11 months ago! My wife graduated from TLC in January 2018. When she arrived April 2017 she was pregnant, and broken. She was sent on a court order which infuriated me. Neither of us realized how badly she needed to go to The Lovelady! My 2 children went there to live with her in June 2017, and our 3rd baby arrived August 2017. Had she not gone to TLC, she wouldn't have learned to live first for God and the rest would fall into place, nor would I. Even after moving out of the center they are still there for her, they're there for us! The people are amazing people of God and are an amazing support system!! They're still our family and friends and to be honest, we've never known friends, love, and support the way they've shown to our family! God knows what he's doing, and he sent my wife there for a reason. Had he not, I don't know where my family would be today. Many thanks and much love to all of the folks at The Lovelady Center!

name: Leah Logan
text: I love it here!

name: Brenda Sullivan
text: MY NAME IS BRENDA SULLIVAN McCLENEY AND I WAS SENT TO THE LOVE LADY CENTER BY THE STATE OF ALABAMA ON THE SUPERVISED RELEASE PROGRAM WHERE I SPENT MY LAST 9 MONTHS OF INCARCERATION THERE.. I MUST ADMIT THAT WHEN I FIRST ARRIVED IT WAS VERY OVERWHELMING...AFTER SPENDING SOME TIME WITH THE AMAZING PEOPLE THAT OWN AND RUN THE LOVE LADY THE OVERWHELMING FEELING THAT I HAD WAS REPLACED WITH THE FEELING OF PEACE AND MY WHOLE LIFE HAS BEEN CHANGED BECAUSE OF THIS PLACE!!!MRS BRENDA,,MRS MALINDA AND MY BEAUTIFUL CLIENT REP MRS TAMMY PORTER SHOWED ME MORE LOVE THAN I COULD EVER HAVE IMAGINED AND MADE ME WANT TO BE A BETTER PERSON!! THIS PLACE HAS TAKEN ME FROM PRISONER TO PRINCESS AND I THANK GOD FOR THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE ONE OF MRS BRENDAS MANY LOVE LADY SUCCESS STORIES...

name: Kayla Brown
text: I as well as my daughter lived at the Lovelady center as I went through the program! If a person wants a new life the opportunity is there! Mrs Brenda, Melinda and the rest of the staff were always there to help! My daughter enjoyed the time there as she got to make friends and play as I sometimes worked in the Education and Kids zone! I would recommend this place to anyone seeking second chances and a sober life! Most of all they offer HOPE and LOVE as well as support!!! Assisted me in my court cases and even today I stand strong and sober without my Gods love my will and their “whole-way house” I would not be where I am today! Thanks Mrs Brendan and Melinda for having that vision where women in need may get that last chance to live and have a free life!

name: Joseph Willingham
text: Amazing place! This place brings women and children to God and sobriety.  To me that is sacred grounds. Addiction is the filthiest place on Earth and i hear people on here talking about dirty rugs.This is spiritual boot camp not the Hilton. if you have a problem with the rugs or playground then go volunteer. Otherwise just sit back and watch the miracle of God"s work. This is a huge opportunity for someone that is willing to put forth the work of learning to have a better life.

name: Amanda Whitman
text: I have no clue who R is but I am a Lovelady and they have never charged me or my family for my meds.

name: joni rogers
text: God favors this place 🙌 my life was changed, giving thanks to all who answered God's calling, I've seen restoration, healing and pure worship.

name: Susan Lay
text: I was a resident from December 2006 thru June 2007 ... graduated the program and under the supervision of Hugh Thomas and Ms Brenda I started the Job Placement department.  My name was Susan Edgil at the time.  After graduating I continued to live on the 4th floor working on into 2008... I believe I left in March 2008. They provide EVERYTHING NEEDED TO PREPARE TO LIVE YOUR LIFE CLEAN AND SOBER... BUT YOU HAVE TO WANT IT.  IM STILL CLEAN AND SOBER...13 YEARS AND COUNTING!

name: Ashley Head
text: This place has been absolutely  amazing and has already began to work miracles and restoration in my life and with my children from broken to blessed this program truly works if you are ready for a life change and are ready to make that commitment  for yourself then this is definitely  the place to be everyone here is so full of love and support.

name: Jennifer Creech
text: Wonderful place and people. Changing lives daily

name: Christina Keener
text: Loved this place!  Great people and wonderful staff that helped me so much!  Mrs. Brenda will always have a special place in my heart for all that she did for me!!!! 💜💜💜💜

name: Tom Dooley
text: As a volunteer on the pastoral team I've witnessed first-hand this amazing "whole-way house" holistic program.  Each week I speak with dozens of women who are being transformed from addicts and incarcerated individuals into precious Loveladies.  This is an exemplary faith-based recovery center.  ti works.

name: Maranda&Paul Godwin
text: My name is Maranda Harville. I was incarcerated in 2011, 2012 for drug related problems. My life was great BUT I didnt know it! I've been reading what some of the ladies have said about this place so I decided to tell my story!!! THANK GOD! THAT I WAS SENT HERE. My community corrections officer an my mom an dad found this place for me. I was afraid an overwhelmed just like a few others, in the beginning! Not completely knowing what to expect an being away from everything and everyone I knew. That was key tho, an very soon into my journey I would find this out. The date that I am writing this is May2nd2019 an I have been COMPLETELY 100% clean an sober since the day i walked out of this place. 1st an foremost it takes a desire to change. 2nd it takes help. An 3rd it takes a higher power! Speaking for myself and only myself I found all of these things here at THE LOVELADY! God has always been a huge part of my life BUT I refound Him here. You see even tho He never left me I NOT ONLY LOST MYSELF IN MY ADDICTION I LOST HIM. An IN RECOVER YOU HAVE TO HAVE A HIGHER POWER!!! I choose for mine to be God! Mrs.Brenda, Mrs.Melinda, Ms.Brandi, an i definitely cant forget Pastor Lesley an Pastor Mullins! An so many more from admin to exit! I cant say enough good about them all. All of them have made it possible for females like me to learn how to live again. Of course there is some bad BUT all in all it was a great experience FOR ME! I was reading a post from a Ms.Silas an I completely disagree. The foodstamp stuff and the thrift store stuff is completely untrue! This program is Blessed, The Hand of God is on this place because they do so much good! There was a store where you could treat yourself an they do take foodstamps for your convenience. They do try an get you back out into the working world BUT IF YOU HAVE ISSUES THEN YOU CAN WORK WITHING THE FACILITY! Ms.Silas failed to tell you how you do schooling you can have your children here, they can go to school as well. So many good things an I will stand firm on this!!! THANK YOU LOVELADY CENTER! TO ALL WHO WERE THSRE WHEN I WAS THERE AN TO ALL WHO ARE THERE STILL AN NOW... CONTINUE TO DO WHAT YOU DO!!! IF WE WANT CHANGE IT CAN BE FOUND HERE!!!

name: Cindy Isaacs
text: I have watched miracle after miracle turn women's lives around.  This establishment is great for any woman that wants to turn her life around.

name: Kimberly Pickron
text: This place is truly God's house.. Amazing

name: Lisa
text: I have learned who I was..who I am and who i will become! This place has changed my life and the people here have become my family!

name: Rani Chapman
text: There are pros and cons. Some good programs offered. But the mold and mildew make even the staff sick.I called the health dept to no avail. I called the state rep for that area and within an hour my dau. -in-law was kicked out for an offense that wasn't proven.The food is mostly donated expired food that isn't safe to eat.  And they get and keep 100% of each girls food stamps. Item donated  are then sold to the girls. And they charge family members for drugs paid for by medicaid and medicare.

name: shirley mccord
text: I called the Center last week to report a problem with a patient. The operator said she would have someone call me and I could tell her what happened. The return call never came. I have been a supporter for this center for years, am a christian countsler for girls with hurts and hang ups. This is very disappointing to me since this young lady has been in several faclities  including Love lady several time.

name: Lily Roberson
text: This place helped me and my mom develop a better relationship and it helped her with responsibility and a lot more

name: Laura Diane Bailey
text:
They helped my sister Karen brewer ,she is now drug and alcohol free, Thanks for all your help and support that you all did for her,GOD BLESS THE LOVELY LADIES CENTER,
THANK YOU,LAURA BAILEY

name: Lisa Hester
text: Miss Brenda and her loveladies helped my sister become free from her addictions and got her to start believing in God, trusting in Him and following His ways! I will be forever grateful to this center for changing a woman we thought would never change. I pray nothing but the best for your success in helping the lost become found and changing the worst into the best! Thank you so much to all the loveladies at the Lovelady Center in Birmingham AL.

name: Steve Pruett
text:
Lady at the desk was cold and non-receptive..
Dis not have any ideas how to help us with a family member.
They wanted $ up front (non-refundable) if our relative runs 2 days in, we lose it all!!
No acceptance letter or contract until theu get $...
We will go else where.
Oh btw, ive I've served in ministries helping people with addictions for many years.  I was sad to see such a cold lady to talk to!!

name: Sheena King
text: I love this place because this is where i found what ive been searching for....GOD

name: Susan McDonald
text: GOD TRULY TRANSFORMS AT THE LOVELADY CENTER!! THANK U GOD FOR THE LOVELADY CENTER!!

name: Janet Caldwell
text: From visiting this place and observing it is a hazard and the poor kids that are there having to live in there is horriable who would put children with over 400 drug addicts coming in off the streets they get there cash assistance a d food stamps from these kids I hope it gets shut down or at least the kids will get taken out of there

name: Nelta Cox
text: Save my life! Tks miss Brenda spann for answering gods calling:)

name: Brenda Kirksey
text: Awesome place to be I was there in 2010-2011. I'm going back there tomorrow

name: Jerry Ippolito
text: //////Gynarchy now!

name: Ginger Tunnell
text: Wonderful place

name: Courtney Woods
text: This is an amazing place

name: Michael Witt
text: Because my Sister is going there to get help for addiction problems.

name: Bad Babies
text: This place needs to be shutdown!!!!!!

name: jacob Fleming
text: It the best it nice to be a love lady

name: Brett Rogers
text: this place is a hoax/scam. a bunch of greedy, hypocrites.

name: Alex Ream
text: I have been a Trussville Y member for three years and still believe in the great value the Y membership has to offer. My only wish is extending evening hours for those who want to visit after work. But I understand the pandemic has affected the operations schedule quite a bit.

resp.text: We are pleased you have chosen the YMCA as your partner in Healthy Living and are committed to providing the best possible experience for you and your family.  We have extended our hours Monday-Thursday 5:00am-8:00pm, Friday 5:00am-7:00pm and Saturday 8:00am-5:00pm, Sunday 12:00pm-5:00pm.  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughts with us ! See you at the Y!!!!

name: Steven Baker
text: I love the equipment at the Y! The staff is awesome and helpful. Everyone is really friendly! I highly recommend the YMCA for getting yourself into shape.

name: John Rankin
text:
I've been going to the Trussville YMCA for about ten years.  The staff is consistently cordial, helpful, and very busy, working with a diverse gender-age membership with various needs and preferences for exercise.

I would like to see two or three more smith machines, as they allow typical basic weightlifting exercises without a partner to spot you. Especially helpful when flexibility, balance, and form are not what they used to be.

resp.text:
John,

Thank you for the comment.  We strive to provide excellent customer service at all times and sincerely appreciate you recognizing that effort.  We are also always looking for ways to improve and continue to make our members happy.  Thank you again for taking the time to provide feedback for our staff.

name: Delores Armstrong
text: I Love the Y @Trussville!!!  The staff is great, facility is clean and well managed.  The group classes are the best.  I especially enjoy the community engagement from the blood drives to the scholarships for those less fortunate.  The YMCA is a jewel in the Trussville community.

resp.text: Thank you Delores!  You are so sweet and we have really appreciated the time that you have volunteered to the Trussville Y!

name: George Barnett
text: The Trussville YMCA has foresight when it helps the area wide community with many needs. Families all over the region benefit from coat, food, and blood drives hosted at the Trussville YMCA. After school care for those who may not always be able to afford the cost. Welcoming place to exercise and be more healthy.

resp.text: Hi George!  Thank you for your kind words!  We have been truly blessed to have such wonderful members who have contributed to each of these causes and helped make our community stronger! - Dana

name: Kathleen Langsdale
text:
As an upcoming senior citizen, I love the fact the Trussville Y offers membership scholarships to those who are unable to join because of their income.  Helping seniors is so important to help keep us "wiser adults" active and live longer and healthier.
The Trussville YMCA is a wonderful place for fellowship, exercise and overall fun for all ages.  In today's world, where can you go that is totally a positive atmosphere where you can get all 3 advantages.  And if you are in any sort of need, the Trussville Y is there to help even if it is outside their realm  They are an awesome place to join and enjoy!!!!!
•	Provide a place for fellowship, exercise, and fun

resp.text: Thanks Kathleen!  We are so glad that you've had such great experiences at our branch!  If you want to make sure you have ALL of the most current information about what's going on at the Trussville YMCA, you can follow us on Facebook (Trussville YMCA) or swing by the Welcome Center to update your email address so you get our monthly newsletter!  We look forward to seeing you soon. - Dana

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: Clean facilities and friendly staff. We visit this location the most, I think because of the upkeep, equipment variety, indoor pool, and staff.

name: Vicki Stanford
text: Great place to improve mobility and physical stamina. The staff is friendly and helpful, and there is a program for everyone. I swim laps and am beginning physical training to improve balance and strength. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks Vicki!  We are so happy to hear about your personal progress!  Thanks for being one of our AMAZING members!

name: Denise folkerts
text: The Trussville YMCA is an asset to this community.  The staff is friendly and cares about the mission.  Staff is constantly working to support community with education classes and other projects. Good Job!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Denise!  We love supporting the community making a difference in the lives of those around us!

name: Alonzo Taylor
text:
A new member was complaining in the men's locker room today about a smell coming out the steam Room in the  Men's locker ROOM😳😢 is  filthy !!!!!! And stays that way I've been complaining about this for months!!! me and several other members was talking about this problem today and we agree it's no use of complaining about it because nothing will get done. Steam room walls are BROWN with DIRT and BACTERIA !!!!😢 most of the time the hot tub it's not working properly  or it's cold !!!! It's a shame when you have to go other YMCAs to go to a CLEAN facility
for your membership. I never have this problem when I go to the other branches in town!!! Shades Valley, Hoover , Pelham SPOT LESS!! I always see people in Maintenance Cleaning the locker room except for the Trussville location !!😢 I have never in my LIFE been to a GYM so filthy and dirty just hope no one catches a staph infection!!! Very disappointed.

resp.text: Hi Alonzo!  Thank you for your message.  I am so sorry to hear that you have not had a great experience at the Trussville YMCA.  I would love for you to contact me so I can talk to you more about your concerns and to let you know about some of the improvements and updates that are coming!  - Dana Larkin (205) 655-2224

name: juan waggoner
text: Love the gym just wished equipment in child care was cleaned better. My kid ended up catching MRSA from the dirty play equipment.

resp.text: Hi Juan!  I see that you haven't visited our facility in quite some time, so I wanted to reach out and let you know that since your last visit, we have had a few changes in management.  We would love to help you get re-engaged with the facility and make sure that you have a fabulous experience!   We are sorry to hear about any negative experience you've had at the Trussville YMCA, but please feel free to reach out to me anytime with questions or concerns!  - Dana (205) 655-2224

name: Bryan Blackmon
text: The Y is an excellent place to let off some steam or get some steam, in the steam rooms. This is one of the very few locations in the Birmingham Metro area that has a swimming pool that is open year around and that is fantastic.

name: Brent Smith
text: Rude staff, especially the director. If you dont work for a living, they will give memberships away. However, those of us who go to work everyday and pay our bills; they charge out the nose.

resp.text: We apologize for your bad experience. We do offer financial assistance for a reduced rate. We would like to have an opportunity to change your mind about the Y.  Please contact Kim Ryals at KRyals@ymcabham.org

name: Josh Philliy
text: Everything is awesome, especially the staff. But I just wish we had another basketball court or something. Because I hate being kicked off the court for basketball and volleyball practice.

resp.text:
Thank you for the review.  We have the basketball and Volleyball practice schedule posted, sorry for the inconvenience.
YMCA- Trussville

name: Lillian Clemens
text: Love it best place to swim do activities during the summer and a good place to work out

resp.text: We are glad you love the Y!  Thanks, Wendy

name: Jacob Wallace
text: It would be great if they would activities like volleyball in other gym and not kick kids off the basketball court

resp.text: Thank you for your suggestion.

name: venqu v
text: Great place to work out and swim. Wish theyd update the basketball area

resp.text:
Thank you for the review. We are looking into improving the basketball area.  Currently we replacing the floor in the cardio room.
Thank you,
Wendy Newland

name: Scott Crawford
text: As Ys go, the Trussville YMCA is one of the better ones. Large cardio room; free weight room and weight machines; full range of cardio and cross training classes; upstairs track; full sized basketball court; racquetball courts; tennis courts; full size pool with smaller lap pool; and locker rooms with steam room, whirl pool, and showers. The staff is courteous and maintain the gym well.

resp.text: Scott - Thank you for sharing! We are so happy to hear you are enjoying your experience being a member of the Y! We look forward to continuing to serve you.

name: Sam A
text: A. Safe place my boys can go to  for workout activities when there's no school or no after school activities

name: Linda Henry-Jones
text: The workers are very helpful and friendly

name: nicole Lockhart
text: It is a amazing place

resp.text: Nicole, thank you for sharing your love for the Trussville Y!

name: Keith McCall
text: It's a Great Place for Recovery!!!!!

name: Dixie Books
text: The employees and residents here are kind, helpful and loving people. Several years ago, moving Mom in was a breeze. Now that Mom has passed on, they've been compassionate as well as kind,  helpful and loving people. They've made sorting and cleaning Mom's apartment less of a chore just by being themselves. 5+ stars

name: Tommy Harris
text: Clean and safe place for moms

name: jimmy harris
text: Great place for seniors to live.

name: Sandra Thompson
text: Looking for a HUD senior/disabled apartment for friend. It was very nice and secure on the campus of Faulkner University. They only lease out to under 62 if you are handicapped in 10 units. She's been there 16 years and never had any openings. Beautiful place and grounds though. At least a year wait on most places that are safe.

name: Marie Lundbom
text: I pick up a friend. The apartments are nice.

name: Judy Vance
text: Hello this is Judy and I love her Elizabeth Wright apts Apartments Elizabeth Wright was a wonderful lady and tried to help the elderly these apartments are very nice and the management is very good you would like living here it's a nice place thank you goodbye

name: Gloria Williams
text: Home

name: BRENDA DANIELS
text: l Love Elizabeth Wright Apt.

name: DENISE WIGFALL
text: Clean place and beautiful.  Apartment s..

name: patsy guyton
text: It has great sucurity, very quiet and friendly staff.

name: HOYT MIDDLETON
text: Nice and convenient

name: Jamie Powell
text: Great place

name: Wanda Reynolds
text: Needs to provide more amenities for the residents!!!!!

name: Us M
text: They really need more funding. I was seeing a Real psychiatrist four about 4 yrs. When i got comfortable with her came back she was gone. No notice or nothing. Now i aee a nurse practioner on a tv screen who knows nothing about me. No paychiatrist stay long there

name: Denise Mack
text: Ok my son been doing everything they ask of him.His social worker had been calling from a private number not letting him know it that she will be doing it so he goes to court and the judge thinks he's been avoiding her that's when my son found out about she been calling from a private number. So I think that is unacceptable on her behalf I hope she know who I'm talking about!!!!!!

name: Tracy Nicole Fisher
text: A Women's Place is a truly great treatment center. They do care so much and want you to get better. Marcy, Crystal, Kia, Mrs. Cathy love you all!!! I did what they told me to do after discharge and I've been sober over a year now.

name: Rachel S
text: My husband was having breathing problems and chest pains, it was late, so we had to go to the ER. $2000+ dollars later, they told us it was panic attacks and sent us on our way. Later went to an Urgent care for same issue who referred us to this place. It was the best. Doctor was super nice ( wow ) and they set up follow ups and just helped us make headway with this issue, finally. The ER made us feel  violated.

name: Valerie Brown
text: I will be forever Grateful, honestly words can not describe the love I feel for these women!! Ms. Marcy and Ms. Kim, I have heard how wonderful and powerful women y’all are!! I thank God he blessed us with having known y’all. You all have me back my baby, and gave her back to Christ!! I pray that God blesses you all through the rest of your journey!❤️

name: Teresa Laney
text: A Woman's Place (part of Indian Rivers) is absolutely amazing! The staff truly cares about the ''residents' and want then to lead the best life! Teaching the ladies how to continue life without drugs/alcohol with the different activities and outside meetings! I went there 2-3 years ago and it really helped! I got to the root of my problem, dealt with it, and moved forward with knowledge and skills to be a productive member of society, and a better mother for my children. name: Josie Stanley
text: I called Crossroad's Community Outreach yesterday on behalf of someone else, needing help, resources or simply, advice. I was met with condescension and a lack of willingness to listen. Without knowing about my situation, only what I briefly left in a voicemail, the woman I spoke to talked to me with a disrespectful tone and only told me what I had done wrong and that I needed to stop. I was appalled that someone who has no clue who I am, or anything about my situation, would give me such rude "advice" before even getting the reason of why I was calling. Unfortunately, the phone call ended and I only felt worse about the circumstances. Needless to say, the service I received was disappointing and I hope that no one else reaching out to this organization will receive the same treatment as me.

resp.text: Our goal is to do everything we can to help those in need or make a referral. It may seem unnecessary & even insensitive but in order to see if you even qualify for our services we have to ask very direct & personal questions about the situation that is part of the process. Were sorry your experience with our organization was not what you expected & we pray you were able to get the help you needed elsewhere. Youre welcome to contact us if you would like to discuss. Be blessed!

name: A Boyd
text: I came in as a guest with my sister who is a member. Wanted to get a membership but wanted to try a class out first. We called the day before and asked what all we needed to bring for me to do a class with her. Was told all we needed was $10. I get there with $10 in cash and then I’m told “oh we don’t accept cash” which of course was not told to me on the phone. But it was fine my sister asked if she could just charge it to the card on file. Then she asks for my drivers license that I don’t have with me because I was never told that I needed to have it. All the while I’m trying to remain calm even though this is very annoying because I did everything right and called the night before and asked what I needed to have and NONE of this was mentioned. The woman at the front desk was extremely rude and said “well your sister is a member and should have known what you needed to have.” My sister has never brought a guest before and again WE CALLED AND ASKED and were not told any of this. It was very disgusting and embarrassing the way the woman was talking to us. Needless to say, I’m not getting a membership there anymore. This was very disappointing.

name: Rachel Tucker
text: The group fitness instructors are an exceptional team. They’re all phenomenal teachers and community builders. For me, they’ve made the difference in my experience at this YMCA. Otherwise, it’s a beautifully maintained facility. The mission of the organization and the way it’s run make membership well worth it.

name: The Connor and Jacob Channel
text: Pretty decent gym. Friendly atmosphere most of the time.  Lots of machines although it seems many of the treadmills have glitchy TVs. Wish the pool was open later on weekends and cleaner...especially the outside pool. Pool staff has been unwelcoming in the past. I know they are mostly kids but they should probably have some training in how to treat the kids they are watching. We've always liked the private swimming lessons experience and those instructors have always been excellent. We used to love the Kids Night Out program, but they've made it less conducive for our child who is not into socializing. I wish they had some kind of classes for beginners especially yoga. Administrative people are nice but don't seem to be on the same page with information. Cleaning attendants are friendly and always hard at work. Now that my children are 8 and 11 they do not feel comfortable going in the ladies dressing room which I totally agree with but I do not feel comfortable letting them go in the men's area because there is no privacy for them. I'm not comfortable with them being exposed to naked men or having to expose themselves. Probably a lot to ask for a kids dressing area or family room. There is a changing room/storage room by the pool but I think it's really just meant for storage. It would be great if they would post the status of the pool on Facebook or via text. It's kind of inconvenient to get there only to discover it is closed because of a distant rumble.

name: Yosef Aborady
text: They have horrible hours of operation. Wi-Fi coverage is so spotty and when you do have a connection it’s super slow there’s no cellular signal because it is a metal building. Staff are clueless and who doesn’t open until one on Sunday it’s absolutely ridiculous. My advice to anyone would be to go to planet fitness for the same type of atmosphere half the price only thing you’re missing out on is a pool.

My own children now carry on this wonderful tradition where they learn core values like respect, responsibility, honesty and caring.

name: Joe Treadway
text: Hey everybody. Here is my review of Habitat for Humanity. A wonderful charity that does so much good but kind of difficult to make donations. They sent me a gifts in kind link but as my donation was more than $5,000.00 they explained that I would need to obtain an appraisal. A representative did recommend The St. Lucie Appraisal Company who was able to use my list of donated items to prepare the personal property appraisal I needed. They also completed the necessary IRS Form 8283. I highly recommend Habitat for Humanity.  Call The St. Lucie Appraisal Company if your donation exceeds $5,000.00.

name: Scott Hattis
text:
This is a great place to go if you are homeless. They offer a 15 minute shower on a first come first served basis if you sign the shower list when you first arrive. You can sign up to receive mail here. They have hygiene products, over the counter medicine, they feed you every day that they are open both breakfast and lunch.

It does help to get there early, because it does get crowded fast. DO NOT LEAVE ANY OF YOUR VALUABLES UNATTENDED, THEY WILL GROW LEGS AND WALK OFF. Also one stop is in a bad neighborhood, so outside of one stop, watch your surroundings.

They do offer a case manager but you must show up for 10 days, (not in a row, they give you a punch card that must have 10 punches on it before you can be assigned a case worker.)  I don't really know exactly what more they do other than point you to what you are looking for.

text: First Stop offers many services to the homeless and provides life changing connections.

name: Lauren Isom
text: Well...it takes an act of God and a visit from the owner of the facility plus Mayor intercession to get absolutely anything accomplished....beyond food, coffee, basic survival needs....good luck getting Jason the Case Manager to do anything.....but if you enjoy good company, coffee, food and routine appearances by HPD....well it might be for you....but if you actually require bus tickets, housing, or help with medication .....it would be better off funded by a reality show....because basically what this place is babysitter's club for the homeless.

name: Lisa Clark
text: They provide a meal and showers, but I know a couple of people who were going to 1st stop because they were truly wanting help and truly wanted off drugs and a new start to their lives, I hope the new director is better I'll leave that at that. Each question ask as far as actual help to the people who were honestly seeking an wanting better, each request was " Oh,we don't help with this But if you need anything else just let me know " it didn't matter what the request ask was the answer was always the same reply. The facility did enjoy the free labor getting the garden's built,started, building in the back built but it is like so very many of this type of organizations, they want your donations of money but such little help provided. The old director did ride around in very new expensive vehicles. I was shocked but mainly disappointed in things that went on and what, how people are treated and the little done to help the homeless including some of the homeless Veterans that also lived in the Tent city very close to the building. I decided when I help I go myself into the camp to donate. I know many people are scared to go into the actual camp especially alone. Just take someone with you if you are afraid, you can't show fear to some that are there due to mental illness and yes I always had my buddy on my hip. But there truly are some very good people in the homeless camps,and they need help if nothing else food,water, sleeping bags, ect. Your little bit you yourself provides is a LOT more than almost all of the organizations do for them.

text:
My husband and I had the most amazing time at Caritas! We were welcomed with open arms as soon as we arrived and loved the private tour we were given. The community is faith-filled, vibrant and joyful!

We especially loved the hike to the Cross on the mountaintop. It truly is a hidden gem and we recommend it to everyone! On the hike up are the Stations of the Cross, which is very profound. We’re so thankful for our time on our own little pilgrimage in Alabama!

We learned a lot about Our Lady of Medjugorje and truly felt Her presence with us. God is great and we will definitely be back soon!

name: Janet Stewart
text: Because of this unusual beautiful holy place, I was awarded the opportunity of a lifetime.  To meet the visionary Marija, and to be present at many apparitions of the Blessed Virgin Mary.  These circumstances are almost indescribable.  Would take a book to explain.  The people who live and work at Caritas are wonderful people...(not perfect people; like many expect them to be), but some of the best people I have ever met and known.  To have been a part of these Miraculous episodes is to have been Graced beyond anything I ever imagined!  Thank you for Terry's insight and never ending fortitude, and all the people who work there untiringly to promote the Greatest Gift the world has ever known since Jesus Christ, our Lord and Savior, became Man in order to save our lives!!  Sincerely with Love, Janet

name: Michael Hebert
text: Caritas is a dedicated Christian community, of a number of real growing families, living in a manner reminiscent of Early Christian Church Communities, written of in the Book of Acts.  While some reviewers may speak improperly,  regarding them, the majority of people familiar with Caritas and Terry (A Friend of Medjugorje), recognize Caritas as a special place, blessed with the presence of Our Lady, and a lifestyle, unhampered, by the modernism of today.  Many things, written in humility, by Friend of Medjugorje,  have become evident as truth, as time moves forward.  While no one, or group, can claim to be perfect, Caritas sets a wonderful example of how best to live the precepts of a Christian life.  While the narrow path they choose, isn't chosen by everyone, in this world, it exemplifies a profound dedication to Love, Hope, Charity, and Perseverance.  Anyone seeking to understand, what God's Blessings, can truly mean, if one dedicates their life to Christ, through Our Holy Mother, only needs to visit this Heavenly place, in Alabama. May God continue to Bless these wonderful people.

name: Mike Capelle
text:
Caritas of Birmingham is a truly blessed place. My family visited there almost 4 years ago and we have been coming back ever since. Walking around their grounds you can tangibly feel the presence of Our Lady & Her spouse the Holy Spirit. Getting to see the witness of the community members over the past 4 years has deepened my faith, has led to a deeper conversion within my family, and has led to a personal indescribable love for Jesus, His Mother Mary, and His Church. The thing that really stood out to me was the love that the community members showed each other and showed my family. I have a fairly rambunctious group of kiddos and their energy only brought loving smiles. Smiles during the Rosary, during the Chaplet of Divine Mercy, and all of their interactions with them. They are a beautiful community focused on introducing the world to Our Lady of Medjugorje to bring as many souls to Jesus as they possibly can.

If you get a chance to visit, take the time to:  1) Pray the Rosary in the Field of Apparitions where Our Lady of Medjugorje has appeared prior to apparition time (rosary starts at 11:00am in the summer // 10:00am in the spring/fall). 2) Pray the Stations of the Cross on a hike to the Cross on top of Penitentiary Mountain. 3) Hike the mountain across the valley from the Cross to the Grotto La Pluie. 4) Pray the Chaplet of Divine Mercy at 3:00pm.

Lastly, satan hates this place because of the community's love of Our Lady & their work of bringing more people to Jesus through His Mother.  People's negative reactions to this beautiful community can only be explained through that perspective.

John 15:18-21: 18 “If the world hates you, know that it has hated me before it hated you.[a]  19 If you were of the world, the world would love its own; but because you are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.  20 Remember the word that I said to you, ‘A servant[b] is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.  21 But all this they will do to you on my account, because they do not know him who sent me".

Matthew 7:16-18: 16 "You will know them by their fruits. Are grapes gathered from thorns, or figs from thistles? 17 So, every sound tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears evil fruit.  18 A sound tree cannot bear evil fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit".

Through Mary to Jesus,
Mike

name: Kei Christensen
text:
It's not that big, but it's pretty nice, and I like it because it's very close to me (which is great because most of the thrift stores are out in Huntsville).

The workers are pretty nice.

There isn't much of a selection of clothes. Not much of a selection of anything, really, since it's small, but it's still fun to look around.

Clothes: minimal selection. Shoes: pretty good (good selection of baby shoes). Electronics: minimal. Furniture: none, last time I looked. There used to be some, I don't know what happened to it. Books: good selection. Trinkets: good selection. Crafts: minimal. Toys: good selection (their stuffed animals are free, last time I looked). Hardware: good selection (lot's of brass and lighting). Bedding: pretty good, but a lot of old fashioned styles.

They have a little "boutique" area for the nice clothes and "name brand" things. But don't buy expensive name brand...my mom donated a fake Coach purse she bought in NYC for $45, and the thrift store is selling it for $50.

You are a true one in a million peace brother and it is a great honor to know you and walk along this beautiful path with you. Satu satu saaaatu peace bear _()_ =D <3

name: Nena Nimit
text: I have been a student and volunteer at the Meditation Center for over a decade now. This is the most kind, loving and generous, positive and uplifting meditation center I have ever been to. All the peace seekers and volunteers have become my family and I truly could not imagine life without them. The Meditation Center saved my life while I was struggling to find balance in medical school and going through many stressors in  life. Mindfulness has helped me deal with anxiety and day to day stressors. The classes give me a consistent structure to keep up my practice and the teachers have helped me to greatly to progress in my meditation. The meditation retreats and special peace events are some of the most positive memories of my life. I am so thankful to the director, all the students, peace family and sangha that gather here every week to support each other along the path to inner peace and happiness. This small microcosm of different people from different backgrounds, religions and walks of life gathering together in kindness and peace has shown me that it is true. Sustainable world peace can be achieved when each individual person finds their own inner peace and balance in life. I am forever grateful to the Meditation Center of Alabama. Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you Nena!! Much loving kindness, The Meditation Center of Alabama

name: Felicher Jones
text: A great place to go to learn how to meditate! Very warm and friendly atmosphere! It is like going to the united nation because the people who attend are very diverse! I feel very welcome. The space and people are peaceful and beautiful! The instructor spend time with the newcomers to instruct them on meditation while the others do stretch warm up to prepare to meditate. Warm tea is served then everyone come together for a group meditation. Some people sit on the floor , some people sit on chairs depend on their preference. After the meditation session people share their experiences and questions are answered then a meal is served and we fellowship. Great place to meet and mingle.

resp.text: Dear Felicher, Thank you so much for joining our center with your family! You are all so incredibly inspiring, strong, courageous and bright rolde models of peace in this world. name: c herring
text: About 7 years ago I was extremely stressed out. My Blood Pressure was 243/132... I got meds from my doctor that helped some. I saw a Flyer on a 3 Day Meditation Retreat. I needed rest so I thought I would try it. I was Welcomed Overwhelmly by Volunteers and Professionals. Doctor Nena sat down with me for a rather lengthy discussion on my Stress. With her Advice and the Lectures I was able to learn how to recognize when my Stress was coming on and Stop it before it got out of hand. Her and the entire "Meditation Family" has helped me though Very Difficult times. The passing of my Dad is just one example of their Support. If it wasn't for me attending The 3 Day Retreat....I know without a Doubt that I would not be here today. I can not give this Group just 5 Stars and 10 Stars would still not be Enough. Their Love and Compassion goes Far Beyound That.

name: John Bobbitt
text:
I've given poor reviews to the other Goodwills in this area based on my personal experiences... But haven't yet reviewed this location. It's here that your donations arrive and are priced, and then are sent To various branches for sale. There's an elderly gentleman who is in charge of electronics, who does this pricing. And he's an outright con artist.

That said, he's the reason primarily for the majority of my poor reviews at other locations, as it happens. He told me once that his prices were "on par with eBay". And I retorted, "the people on eBay are making some of the money back that they spent on the product initially. That's the entire point. They're sold at a discounted price because they're used. They're not donations such as the things found at the Goodwill. The point for you is to make a profit, but when there's no overhead, it's all profit! So if a set of speakers cost $200 brand new, and they're twenty years old, and they were free to you, there's no reason to not let him go for thirty bucks or less. It's all free money". When I donate items to the Goodwill it's not only for the money to go towards the community or whatever, it's so that somebody can get something nicer that they can generally afford. A "come up" or a "blessing". And for the money to go bsck to my community. Not to scalp my fellow shoppers. Check out woth Google how much their CEO made last year, when you have time.

Then there's the issue of the products themselves. There's no returns, and the vast majority of the electronics you're not in a position to test without a computer maybe, or an audio system capable of powering whatever device you're looking at. I bought an expensive camera once because it powered on so I assumed it was functional, and it wasn't. Couldn't tell until I had it plugged into a computer at home. Once, a streaming player that powered on. Assumed it to work then...but no. It turned itself off after a few minutes without the remote...which it didnt have. Another time I bought a set of vintage speakers cabinets but didn't have the presence of mind to check if there were any speaker drivers inside. That's right, they were Hollow. He's told me that he checks them with a 9-volt battery which is a very plebeian way of doing it. That will just tell you if they're blown completely out, not that there's anything wrong with them. Not to mention, he definitely didnt check with a 9-volt battery the speakers that he sold me. As an example of his overpriced foolishness, I saw today a set of soundtech vintage speakers commonly used by DJ's for sale. Expensive. Maybe $1000 new.  My first thought after my previous experience was to take the covers off and make sure that they were drivers inside and what did I find? A whole other brand. I'll Grant you cerwin Vegas aren't bad speakers, and in fact my Mains at home are Cerwin Vegas. Probably the best rock and roll speakers ever made. But these are definitely not those models, and theyre definitely not worth the price of a sound tech set such as match the covers that are on there (that they lead you to believe that they are). In fact, most people would hesitate before removing the covers for fear of damaging them....so you wouldn't know. Those speakers sold for $60-sonething bucks EACH (NOTHING SHOULD COST THAT AT GOODWILL for one, and two, separating vintage sets should have you shot at dawn) are REALLY worth far less.

I saw a man loading them up and attempted to hip the guy, but he was of a different skin color than me, and immediately became very defensive and rude. As a white male visiting the south.... I've learned to not even bother. So he can find out for himself.

Rip off artists here.

name: David Moylan
text: I’ve had the pleasure of volunteering at M-power at both the Education and Health center for the better part of 2 years. I have personally witnessed how M-Power has enriched the lives of so many people in the poorer communities of Birmingham. I was disappointed to hear about a recent controversy surrounding the turning away of a volunteer on the grounds of their faith, or at that pretense. I can only speak to my personal experiences there, but I have met some of the most wholesome and generous people through that organization. I hope to appeal to people’s better nature in saying that we are all flawed and can sometimes be misguided in our judgements and actions. I’m confident those involved in this controversy will learn from this and I implore people not to lose faith in M-Power's mission to serve the community.

Definitely not somewhere I would look into going after hearing the things this organization thinks of people. Do better.

name: Kinsley Law
text: 100% awful group of people. When one of my friends tried to better the community and those in it by volunteering with this organization, they turned him away simply because of his beliefs and judged him by the way he looked. Don’t call yourselves Christians then turn those away who appear different to you. Christ did not turn people away, but welcomed them into his embrace and loves selflessly. Terrible excuses for Christians and should not be allowed to call themselves a “ministry”.

name: Dylan Fisher
text: Judgmental organization. Went to observe a class to volunteer for this organization and was instantly judged for my appearance and my beliefs. Filled paperwork out and was left to observe a class for an hour before they pulled me out and told me I cannot volunteer for them since I’m not Christian. I asked why this matters if your organization wants to educate illiterate adults or students who have dropped out and want to pursue their GED. When you won’t accept diverse volunteers who are capable to help the community that is what I view as disgusting. After this they bluntly told me they don’t let Indians volunteer because they are Buddhist and do not hold the Christian faith when neither pertained to me but they wanted to give me more examples of their discrimination. There is nothing wrong with being a faith based organization until you put others down when your goal is supposed to be “bridging the gap for people in poverty”.

name: Mallory Barrett
text: This ministry has disappointed me. The fact they will not accept my friend for being not of their standards is unacceptable. As a Christian this is not how we are suppose to act towards others that we may not have the same viewpoints. If I could give this review a 0 I would give it that. In Galatians 5:14 it talks about loving our neighbors as we should love ourselves. This is NOT how we should love another we should be in open arms. Highly disappointed and expected better.

text: I would put 0/5 but it is impossible. The amount of anger I feel is immense. This organization denied my friend based on their religious views. Should we really be basing a volunteer program due to their religious views? No. Do better.

name: Sarah Garrett
text: My friend wanted to take time out of his own day & volunteer to help illiterate adults with their literacy skills, but was denied and asked to leave due to his appearance & lack of an affiliated church. He was also told by a staff member that their organization doesn’t allow “Indian people because they’re Buddhists” which is not an accurate statement and overlooks the fact that someone who isn’t white can still be Christian. An organization devoted to helping others then denies those who want to help based on discriminatory ideals is counterintuitive and counterproductive. I can only imagine that those they help are also discriminated against, and I can’t imagine they’re in an environment where they feel safe if this is the case. I also discovered on a phone call that there are no policies in place for how to handle a staff making racial, discriminatory remarks. This is not an organization that deserves your support. I can only hope they don’t treat those they assist this way, but that is likely the case. Overall, I’d say they need to get their ducks in a row and strive to be better for both themselves and the community they serve.

name: Courtney Bivins
text: Took my friend here to get assistance for a bill. Upon leaving he was given a paper stating that they would pay one portion while getting the other from another ministry. The bill was to be paid by that Friday and he had been seen Monday of that week. The lady whom he spoke with, Hettie Wagner, stated she would be contacting him the following day. Well, Tuesday came and he heard nothing. Then Wednesday came and still nothing. Finally on Thursday he decided to call and before he could get out what he was calling for he was being greeted by voicemail. The lady that answered the phone didn’t even listen to first 3 words before he was transferred to a voicemail box. He left a voicemail for Hettie Wagner but didn’t receive a call back. Friday rolls around, the day the bill is due, and he still hears nothing so he decides to call again. The same rude lady answer the phone and he asks to speak with Wagner and the lady states that she has a client and sends him to voicemail again where he left another message. Still no reply! Thank God, he had me to call on to help him out because him along with 2 other children would have suffered at the end. If I could give negative stars I would!

name: Laura Walker
text: This organization is willing to give you used clothing from its thrift store, paper towels and toilet paper and cleaning supplies, 3 loaves of day old bread,  etc.  However, they make you jump through a million hoops, make a ;budget or learn to make a budget or both, then promise, after months of meetings with them while seeking assistance to avoid homelessness, they promise they will help, but do nothing.  It is a waste of time, energy and emotion to ask them for help, when you are disabled and as a result are very poor, even though you may be well educated and know how to make a budget, and have lived on one for decades. My experience was very negative, and this was a huge surprise because of the reputation they have of assisting needy folks around town. (They make presentations to various civic groups tooting their own horn about all they do to help people in crisis.)  I wasn't seeking long term help, just enough to  get to a stable place after months of uncertainty and instability, following a sudden surprise displacement from my residence. They claim to have programs to help disabled folks with making rent, and even told my landlord they were sending a check, but never did. Oh, and the;y really pushed for me to be full time employed, even though I am disabled (and have been for 20 years). I would love nothing more than to resume my professional career, if only my spine were not so crippled and preventing me from resuming that career.

name: Betty Caldwell
text: I have been a recipient of Greater Birmingham Ministries in the past. But Friday October 11, 2019 I called and I talked to a Caucasian woman and I ask her what did I have to do to get a referral to Oak Mountain Mission? She said come in Monday at 9:00 A.M. and ask for Mary. I said thank you. I go to the Greater Birmingham Ministries Monday morning October 14, 2019 I arrived at 8:51 A.M. and the building is closed. I was so 😠 angry Why did she lie to me I wasted my little gas for nothing. She knew that place was going to be closed Monday. She knew she was off.  I know that we don't know what condition we will end up in , In this world but we reap what we sow. She might have to use the help of someone else of a ministry one day. Be careful how you treat people. I have to ask God to forgive me in order to forgive her.

name: Kelly S. Atchison
text: I first met Keli in 2012 through work and now have the honor of working with her on different projects for Hatching Hope these past few years. It has been truly incredible watching her and her son take a small, yet ambitious idea and turn it into an organization that has helped so many in such a short period of time! The Birmingham apartment community is lucky to have Keli and her team. They care deeply for people, which pushes them to reach far and beyond Birmingham to provide disaster relief for those in need. Keli and Jessica, keep after it! You're making a difference in the lives of so many! And to those reading this review, YOU can help support Hatching Hope by shopping their Thrift Studio in Alabaster, AL!
